qas.question: Why did airport construction boom during the 1960s?
How far were runways extended out?
What was constructed out of reinforced concrete?
When were jet bridge systems introduced to modern airport terminals?
In what year was there a boom in jet bridge systems?
How far were jet bridge systems extended to?
When was using reinforced concrete a common practice in the US?
What did airport construction eliminate in the 1970's?
What were jet bridge systems made of?

context: Airport construction boomed during <b4_0>the 1960s<b4_0/> with the <a0_0>increase in jet aircraft traffic<a0_0/>. Runways were extended out to <b5_0>3,000 m (<a1_0>9,800 ft<a1_0/>)<b5_0/>. <a2_0>The fields<a2_0/> were constructed out of <b8_0>reinforced concrete<b8_0/> using a slip-form machine that produces a continual slab with no disruptions along the length. The <a3_0>early 1960s<a3_0/> also saw the introduction of jet bridge systems to modern airport terminals, an innovation which eliminated <b7_0>outdoor passenger boarding<b7_0/>. These systems became commonplace in the United States <b6_0>by the 1970s<b6_0/>.
